result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew W Owens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew W Owens is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew W Owens was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Matthew W Owens was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Matthew W Owens was found guilty of Entry into Locked Vehicle [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.11.
  • Matthew W Owens was found guilty of Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).
  • Matthew W Owens was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Matthew W Owens was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Matthew W Owens was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Matthew W Owens was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Total restitution of $12,392.41 broke down as follows: $2,734.00 to Jamie & Betzalel K.; $6,092.00 to Dana & Adam M.; $1,071.41 to Meloney J.; $1,100.00 to Celestine and Medford R.; $50.00 to Rabbi S.; $1,045.00 to Mailee V.; and $300.00 to Fay H.

Pay DNA sucharge, costs and disbursements after restitution is paid.
**Monies to be taken by the DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would be then paid while on Extended Supervision.  If not paid while on Extended supervision, will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Obtain an Associate degree.

No controlled substances or alcohol. 
No contact with any of the victims or their residences.
No contact with coactor Jermaine Washingtion.  No contact with Stephanie P.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Random urine screens to ensure compliance.  Absolute sobriety.

Defendant Matthew W Owens in court with attorney William O. Marquis.  Defendant Matthew W Owens in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for continued sentencing.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:   Susan O.

AS TO COUNT #1:  The Court imposed the following sentence: The Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be ELEVEN (11) years.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for THREE (3) YEARS AND SIX (6) MONTHS with credit for 189 days time served.  Defendant shall serve SEVEN (7) YEARS AND SIX (6) MONTHS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  

AS TO COUNT #2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve NINE (9) MONTHS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to any other time served.

AS TO COUNT #3:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve NINE (9) MONTHS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to any other time served.

AS TO COUNT #5:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve NINE (9) MONTHS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to any other time served.

AS TO COUNT #7:  The Court imposed the following sentence: The Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be ELEVEN (11) years CONCURRENT.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for THREE (3) YEARS AND SIX (6) MONTHS with credit for 189 days time served.  Defendant shall serve SEVEN (7) YEARS AND SIX (6) MONTHS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  

AS TO COUNT #9:  The Court imposed the following sentence: The Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be ELEVEN (11) years CONCURRENT.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for THREE (3) YEARS AND SIX (6) MONTHS with credit for 189 days time served.  Defendant shall serve SEVEN (7) YEARS AND SIX (6) MONTHS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  

AS TO COUNT #11:  The Court imposed the following sentence: The Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be ELEVEN (11) years CONCURRENT.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for THREE (3) YEARS AND SIX (6) MONTHS with credit for 189 days time served.  Defendant shall serve SEVEN (7) YEARS AND SIX (6) MONTHS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  

AS TO COUNT #13:  The Court imposed the following sentence: The Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be ELEVEN (11) years CONCURRENT.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for THREE (3) YEARS AND SIX (6) MONTHS with credit for 189 days time served.  Defendant shall serve SEVEN (7) YEARS AND SIX (6) MONTHS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  

AS TO COUNT #15:  The Court imposed the following sentence: The Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be ELEVEN (11) years CONCURRENT.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for THREE (3) YEARS AND SIX (6) MONTHS with credit for 189 days time served.  Defendant shall serve SEVEN (7) YEARS AND SIX (6) MONTHS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  

AS TO COUNT #17:  The Court imposed the following sentence: The Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be ELEVEN (11) years CONCURRENT.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for THREE (3) YEARS AND SIX (6) MONTHS with credit for 189 days time served.  Defendant shall serve SEVEN (7) YEARS AND SIX (6) MONTHS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

The Court advised the defendant of the determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form CR-234.  Copy provided to defendant. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
 - No controlled substances or alcohol; Absolute sobriety;
 - AODA assessment; treatment, if needed;
 - Random urine screens to ensure compliance;
 - Seek and maintain employment;
 - Obtain an Associate Degree;
 - No contact with any of the victims or thier residences; No contact with co-actor, Jermaine Washington; No contact with Stephanie P.
 - Total Restitution in the amount of $12,392.41 broke down as follows:  $2,734 to Jamie & Betzalel K.; $6,092 to Dana & Adam M.; $1,071.41 to Meloney J.; $1,100 to Celestine & Medford. R.; $50.00 to Rabbi S.; $1,045 to Mailee V.; and $300 to Fay H.
 - Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements AFTER RESTITUTION IS PAID.  Court ordered monies taken by the Department of Correction from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would be then be paid while on Extended Supervision.  If not paid while on Extended Supervision, will result in a civil judgment.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Matthew W Owens in court with attorney William O. Marquis.  Defendant Matthew W Owens in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Pursuant to negotiations, the State moves to dismiss and read-in counts #4, #6, #8, #10, #12, #14, #16 and #18.  The Court GRANTED the State's Motion and ordered those counts DISMISSED.

As to Counts #1, #2, #3, #5, #7, #9, #11, #13, #15, #17:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 30, Judge Conen's court on September 3, 2015 at 1:30pm.
